content.description: Project:An Arete which looks like it can be an amazing route once climbed. I'm guessing it to be about V6 ish but as my max grade is v3 that could be off. The climb starts with a crouch start where the rock is dirty and has a crack running through it, and then follows on Â slopers and rises up on some more slopers. Once you reach the flat part of the arete continue traversing with easier movement to a hard topout right before the arete is about to go down again. Make sure to bring a brush for cleaning as I wasn't able to clean the entirety of the route (but I was able to clean most of it.)If you climb this, please comment down below what grade you think it is and what you thought of the climb. Thanks!
content.protection: There are some thorns in the landing so you'll want to be careful of that, but other than that the landing's good.So 1-2 pads with spotter, and 2-3 pads with no spotter.
content.location: Access via a short, but steep bushwhack from either the first path heading up towards the caves, or by heading towards Zero point wall and then doing another short, flatish bushwack, following the large rock faces.

content.description: A Beautiful boulder that resembles a split sphere, with bright colors, and an amazing sloping arete which is dying to be climbed.
